game.title: firmread
game.description: Tharit 'firmread' Tothong is an artist, creative technologist, and game designer dedicated to exploring politics in play, new interfaces for expression, and opensource education.

history.text: After Tharit 'firmread' Tothong graduated from Architecture school in Bangkok, he participated in several new media workshops and collaborated with leading artists in Bangkok new media arts scene, such as Koichi Shimizu and Joe Nattapol Suphawong, while also explore intersection of architecture and new media through conceptual design pieces. His worked was exhibited in Thailandia in Venice Biennale 2010 and featured in Association of Siamese Architect's Expo for three years in a row. Before he decided to pursuit further exploration in this field and moved to New York in 2011.

He started his first step in new media art scene in New York by joined Parsons The New School For Design for MFA in Design and Technology. There he start making games and contributed extensively in opensource communities, such as a C++ frameworks called OpenFrameworks, and educational opensource translation of Nature of Code book by Daniel Shiffman. He also worked with tech start up companies to develop new tools for non-profit organizations at iGiveMore and exploring future of education at 4.0 Schools.

Now he is collaborating with Zach Lieberman, a co-founder of OpenFrameworks on opensource drawing tool for iPad that explores the future intersection of drawing and computational devices. While also working on iPad game with his friend at Mice And Maze studio.
